title: Cendara University Employee Handbook
chunks:
Cendara University Employee Handbook > Introduction > Welcome to Cendara University! As an esteemed faculty or staff member, you play an essential role in fostering an environment of academic excellence, inclusivity, and professional growth. This handbook provides guidance on policies, benefits, conduct expectations, and the values central to the Cendara University community.

If you have questions at any time, please contact Human Resources at hr@cendara.edu or visit the HR office in Ferris Hall, Room 206.

Cendara University Employee Handbook > Workplace Policies > Equal Employment Opportunity > Cendara University is committed to providing an inclusive workplace free of discrimination or harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or veteran status. Employment decisions are based solely on merit and qualifications.

Cendara University Employee Handbook > Workplace Policies > Attendance and Working Hours > - **Standard office hours:** Monday–Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.
- Faculty hours may vary by teaching schedules.
- In case of absence or late arrival, notify your supervisor or department chair as early as possible.
- Excessive unexcused absences may result in corrective action.

Cendara University Employee Handbook > Workplace Policies > Remote Work and Flexible Scheduling > Cendara University supports a hybrid work environment for eligible positions:

- **Remote work:** Up to 2 days/week with supervisor approval.
- **Flexible schedules:** (e.g., adjusted start/end times) available based on departmental needs.
- Submit requests in writing to immediate supervisors; approvals are assessed case-by-case.

Cendara University Employee Handbook > Workplace Policies > Safety and Emergency Procedures > - Report safety hazards to Campus Safety at (417) 555-3680.
- Participate in required annual safety trainings.
- Fire drills are conducted twice per academic year.
- In emergencies, follow posted evacuation routes and instructions from security personnel.

Cendara University Employee Handbook > Workplace Policies > Use of University Property and Resources > - University devices and resources are for professional, academic, or research purposes.
- Personal use should be minimal and not interfere with operations.
- Unauthorized removal or misuse of university property will result in disciplinary measures.
- All computer usage is monitored under the Information Technology Acceptable Use Policy.

Cendara University Employee Handbook > Workplace Policies > Confidentiality and Data Protection > - Maintain confidentiality regarding student, faculty, and institutional information.
- Do not disclose any sensitive information without proper authorization.
- Comply with FERPA and all applicable data protection policies.
- Report data breaches or suspicious activities to itsecurity@cendara.edu.

Cendara University Employee Handbook > Benefits Overview > Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance > - Comprehensive health coverage through NimbusCare.
- Coverage starts on the first of the month following your hire date.
- Includes annual physicals, prescription drugs, mental health services, and specialist visits.
- Dental and vision plans administered through BrightSmile and OptiView.
- See the Benefits Guide or email benefits@cendara.edu for plan details.

Cendara University Employee Handbook > Benefits Overview > Retirement Plan > - Participation in the Cendara University Retirement Savings Plan (CURSP) is automatic after 90 days of employment.
- University matches employee contributions up to 6% of salary.
- Administered by Granite Financial Services.
- Optional voluntary contributions up to IRS limits.

Cendara University Employee Handbook > Benefits Overview > Paid Time Off (PTO) > | Employee Type        | Annual Vacation | Sick Leave | Personal Days | Holidays      |
|---------------------|----------------|------------|--------------|--------------|
| Full-time Staff     | 20 days        | 10 days    | 4 days       | 12 days      |
| Full-time Faculty   | By appointment | 10 days    | 2 days       | 12 days      |
| Part-time Employees | Pro-rated      | Pro-rated  | 2 days       | 12 days      |

- Unused vacation days may be carried over up to a maximum of 10 days per year.

Cendara University Employee Handbook > Benefits Overview > Professional Development > - Annual stipend of $800 for conferences, workshops, or continuing education.
- Tuition reimbursement for approved coursework at Cendara or partner institutions (up to 50% tuition).
- Access to on-campus seminars and leadership training.

Cendara University Employee Handbook > Benefits Overview > Employee Assistance Program (EAP) > - Free, confidential counseling (up to 6 sessions per year).
- Financial consulting, legal assistance, and support resources for all employees and families.
- EAP contact: (800) 555-9932 or eapservices@cendara.edu.

Cendara University Employee Handbook > Professional Conduct > Code of Ethics > Employees are expected to:
- Demonstrate honesty, accountability, and integrity in all interactions.
- Uphold academic freedom, respect intellectual property, and maintain professionalism.
- Report unethical conduct or conflicts of interest to the Office of Compliance.

Cendara University Employee Handbook > Professional Conduct > Harassment and Discrimination Policy > - Zero tolerance for harassment, discrimination, or retaliation.
- Includes but is not limited to: sexual harassment, bullying, offensive language, and intimidation.
- Incidents should be reported immediately to Office of Equity & Inclusion at equity@cendara.edu.
- All complaints are confidential and thoroughly investigated.

Cendara University Employee Handbook > Professional Conduct > Conflict of Interest > - Disclose any potential conflicts involving personal, financial, or familial interests that could compromise university decisions.
- Employees may not accept gifts in excess of $75 from vendors or partners.
- Conflicts should be reported using the online disclosure form or to your department head.

Cendara University Employee Handbook > Professional Conduct > Dress Code and Appearance > - Business casual is standard for all office and academic settings.
- Lab and clinical staff must adhere to departmental safety attire regulations.
- “Cendara Pride Fridays” permit university-branded casual wear.
- Special dress requirements may apply for events or ceremonies.

Cendara University Employee Handbook > Professional Conduct > Disciplinary Procedures > - Violations of university policies result in progressive discipline:
  1. Verbal warning
  2. Written warning
  3. Suspension
  4. Termination (for serious or repeated violations)
- All disciplinary actions are documented in the employee’s file and handled in accordance with university guidelines.

Cendara University Employee Handbook > Company Culture > Mission and Values > Cendara University fosters inquiry, lifelong learning, and civic engagement. We empower our community members to pursue excellence, innovation, and global citizenship.

**Core Values:**
- Academic integrity and freedom
- Respect and inclusivity
- Service and responsibility
- Creativity and discovery

Cendara University Employee Handbook > Company Culture > Diversity and Inclusion > - Diversity is integral to our academic mission.
- The Mosaic Initiative advances equity for underrepresented groups in faculty and student recruitment.
- Monthly “Voices Forum” discussions and annual Diversity Symposium.

Cendara University Employee Handbook > Company Culture > Collaboration and Communication > - Open-door policy among departments and leadership.
- Annual university retreat (“Connections Day”) each August for cross-campus networking and team building.
- Use of CendaraConnect, an internal communications platform, for updates, discussion, and feedback.

Cendara University Employee Handbook > Company Culture > Community Engagement > - Employee Volunteer Day each spring, supporting local nonprofits.
- Encouragement of staff participation in community lectures, outreach, and K-12 mentoring programs.
- Cendara’s annual Open Campus Festival invites neighbors, alumni, and civic partners to campus.

title: Cendara University
chunks:
Cendara University Department of Psychology Course Catalog 2024-2025 > Undergraduate Courses > ### PSY 101: Introduction to Psychology
- **Credits:** 3
- **Description:**  
  An overview of the major theories, foundational concepts, and methods in psychology. Topics include perception, learning, motivation, development, and social behavior. Designed for students with no prior background in psychology.
- **Prerequisites:** None

---

### PSY 110: Research Methods in Psychology
- **Credits:** 4
- **Description:**  
  Introduction to the scientific method as applied to psychological phenomena. Students learn experimental design, data collection, basic analysis, and ethical considerations. Includes laboratory sessions.
- **Prerequisites:** PSY 101

---

### PSY 211: Developmental Psychology
- **Credits:** 3
- **Description:**  
  Examination of the biological, cognitive, and social development of individuals from infancy through adulthood. Explores key theories and methodological approaches.
- **Prerequisites:** PSY 101

---

### PSY 218: Introduction to Cognitive Psychology
- **Credits:** 3
- **Description:**  
  Exploration of mental processes such as attention, memory, language, perception, and problem-solving. Discussion of experimental findings and theoretical frameworks.
- **Prerequisites:** PSY 101

---

### PSY 230: Social Psychology
- **Credits:** 3
- **Description:**  
  Investigation of how social factors influence individual behavior. Major topics include aggression, conformity, group dynamics, attitudes, stereotypes, and prejudice.
- **Prerequisites:** PSY 101

---

### PSY 250: Abnormal Psychology
- **Credits:** 3
- **Description:**  
  Analysis of the definition, classification, and treatment of mental disorders. Includes an overview of anxiety, mood, psychotic, and personality disorders.
- **Prerequisites:** PSY 101

---

### PSY 312: Biological Bases of Behavior
- **Credits:** 3
- **Description:**  
  Study of the neural and hormonal foundations of behavior, sensation, and motivation. Emphasizes connections between biological mechanisms and psychological processes.
- **Prerequisites:** PSY 101, PSY 110

---

### PSY 320: Introduction to Clinical Psychology
- **Credits:** 3
- **Description:**  
  Survey of the principles and practices of clinical assessment, diagnosis, and treatment of mental health conditions. Emphasis on evidence-based approaches.
- **Prerequisites:** PSY 250

---

### PSY 340: Personality Psychology
- **Credits:** 3
- **Description:**  
  Exploration of classical and contemporary theories of personality, methods of assessment, and research findings.
- **Prerequisites:** PSY 101

---

### PSY 370: Psychological Statistics
- **Credits:** 4
- **Description:**  
  Introduction to descriptive and inferential statistical techniques used in psychological research, including hypothesis testing, ANOVA, regression, and nonparametric approaches. Includes computer-based labs.
- **Prerequisites:** PSY 110, MTH 101 (Introduction to College Algebra)

---

### PSY 399: Independent Study in Psychology
- **Credits:** 1-3 (variable)
- **Description:**  
  Individual study or research project under faculty supervision in a specialized area of psychology. Requires departmental approval.
- **Prerequisites:** Permission of instructor, Junior standing

Cendara University Department of Psychology Course Catalog 2024-2025 > Graduate Courses > ### PSY 500: Advanced Research Methods
- **Credits:** 3
- **Description:**  
  In-depth examination of quantitative and qualitative research methodologies, data analysis techniques, and ethics in advanced psychological research.
- **Prerequisites:** PSY 370 or equivalent

---

### PSY 512: Cognitive Neuroscience
- **Credits:** 3
- **Description:**  
  Study of neural mechanisms underlying cognitive functions such as perception, memory, and decision-making. Readings from current research literature.
- **Prerequisites:** PSY 312

---

### PSY 522: Advanced Developmental Psychology
- **Credits:** 3
- **Description:**  
  Critical analysis of cognitive and emotional development throughout the lifespan. Focus on current issues and empirical research.
- **Prerequisites:** PSY 211

---

### PSY 532: Psychopathology
- **Credits:** 3
- **Description:**  
  Advanced exploration of psychological disorders, diagnostic criteria, underlying mechanisms, and recent research trends.
- **Prerequisites:** PSY 250, PSY 320

---

### PSY 540: Psychological Assessment
- **Credits:** 4
- **Description:**  
  Principles and practices of assessment in clinical psychology, including intelligence, personality, and neuropsychological testing.
- **Prerequisites:** PSY 340, PSY 320

---

### PSY 550: Interventions in Clinical Psychology
- **Credits:** 3
- **Description:**  
  Comprehensive overview of psychotherapeutic interventions, including cognitive-behavioral, psychodynamic, and humanistic approaches. Integrates case studies and supervised practice.
- **Prerequisites:** PSY 532, PSY 540

---

### PSY 561: Seminar in Social Cognition
- **Credits:** 2
- **Description:**  
  Discussion-based seminar focusing on theory and research in social cognitive processes including attitudes, attribution, and emotion regulation.
- **Prerequisites:** PSY 230 (or equivalent)

---

### PSY 580: Teaching of Psychology
- **Credits:** 2
- **Description:**  
  Preparation for teaching undergraduate psychology, covering course planning, assessment, and student engagement strategies. Required for teaching assistants.
- **Prerequisites:** Graduate standing in Psychology

---

### PSY 590: Graduate Thesis
- **Credits:** 6
- **Description:**  
  Original empirical research conducted under faculty mentorship. Culminates in a thesis and oral defense.
- **Prerequisites:** Permission of thesis committee

Cendara University Department of Psychology Course Catalog 2024-2025 > Doctoral-Level Courses > ### PSY 601: Advanced Topics in Clinical Psychology
- **Credits:** 3
- **Description:**  
  Rotating content seminar on topics such as trauma, substance use disorders, and multicultural assessment. Students critically evaluate recent interventions and research.
- **Prerequisites:** Admission to Ph.D. program

---

### PSY 610: Statistical Modeling for Psychologists
- **Credits:** 3
- **Description:**  
  Intensive training in advanced statistical techniques including multilevel modeling, structural equation modeling, and Bayesian estimation.
- **Prerequisites:** PSY 500

---

### PSY 635: Grant Writing in Psychology
- **Credits:** 2
- **Description:**  
  Practical experience in identifying funding sources and developing research grant proposals with feedback from faculty and peers.
- **Prerequisites:** Graduate standing

---

### PSY 650: Doctoral Dissertation
- **Credits:** 12
- **Description:**  
  Completion of an original dissertation project demonstrating substantial contribution to the field of psychology. Includes proposal, data collection and analysis, manuscript preparation, and defense.
- **Prerequisites:** Advancement to candidacy

Cendara University Department of Psychology Course Catalog 2024-2025 > Additional Notes > - All courses are subject to availability and may require consent from instructors or the department.
- Undergraduate students interested in graduate coursework must obtain special permission.
- Credit hours are based on semester system.

For further information, please consult the Department of Psychology office (psychology@cendara.edu) or visit the Cendara University Courses portal.

---

title: Cendara University Affiliations & Exchange Programs
chunks:
Cendara University Affiliations & Exchange Programs > International University Partnerships > Active Affiliations > Cendara University maintains robust institutional affiliations with leading universities and educational organizations around the world. These partnerships facilitate academic collaboration, research initiatives, faculty exchanges, and student mobility.

#### Active Affiliations

| Partner Institution                       | Country         | Type of Collaboration                 | Year Initiated | Key Areas                |
|--------------------------------------------|-----------------|---------------------------------------|----------------|--------------------------|
| Humboldt School of Technology              | Germany         | Student & Faculty Exchange            | 2014           | Engineering, Informatics |
| Royal Institute of Social Sciences         | United Kingdom  | Research Consortium, Joint Seminars   | 2017           | Sociology, Public Policy |
| East Asia University Consortium            | Japan, S. Korea | Dual Degree Programs, Summer Schools  | 2016           | Language, Business       |
| Pontifica Universidad del Sur              | Chile           | Short-term Study Abroad, Joint Grants | 2019           | Environmental Science    |
| Université de la Loire                     | France          | Sabbatical Exchange, Workshops        | 2013           | Humanities, Linguistics  |
| Victoria State University                  | Australia       | Semester Abroad, Joint Research Funds | 2015           | Marine Biology           |

Cendara University Affiliations & Exchange Programs > International University Partnerships > Academic Networks > Cendara University is an active member of:

- **Global Education Connect (GEC):** A network of 250+ universities fostering global teaching and learning innovation.
- **Consortium for Sustainability R&D:** Focused on climate resilience and environmental sciences.
- **Intercollegiate Language Partners (ILP):** Collaborative projects in translation, interpretation, and cross-cultural communication.

Cendara University Affiliations & Exchange Programs > Student Exchange Programs > Outbound Exchange Programs > Cendara University’s Office of International Affairs (OIA) manages a diverse portfolio of exchange opportunities for both inbound and outbound students.

#### Semester & Year-Long Exchanges

- **Eligibility:** Fully enrolled undergraduate or graduate students, minimum GPA 3.0, language proficiency as required by host.
- **Destinations (2024/25 academic year):**
    - Humboldt School of Technology, Berlin (Engineering)
    - Royal Institute of Social Sciences, London (Political Science & Sociology)
    - Université de la Loire, Tours (French Studies, Philosophy)
    - Victoria State University, Melbourne (Environmental Sciences, Marine Biology)

#### Summer Programs

- **East Asia Cultural Immersion (Seoul, Tokyo):** 6-week program featuring language courses, company visits, and cultural excursions.
- **Pontifica Universidad del Sur (Santiago):** 4-week Sustainability and Community Action project.

Cendara University Affiliations & Exchange Programs > Student Exchange Programs > Inbound Exchange Opportunities > Cendara University welcomes over 70 exchange students annually from partner institutions. The following services are provided:

- Pre-arrival orientation 
- Dedicated exchange student housing in Sterling Residence Hall
- Academic advising and language support
- Peer mentorship and local culture introduction

Cendara University Affiliations & Exchange Programs > Faculty & Researcher Exchange > Faculty and research staff at Cendara University have access to:

- **Sabbatical Placement:** Up to 2 semesters at Université de la Loire (Humanities Faculty) or Humboldt School of Technology (STEM departments).
- **Research Collaboration Grants:** Joint funding with partner institutions for bi-annual themed workshops and collaborative research, e.g., the Royal Institute of Social Sciences' annual Urban Studies Colloquium.
- **Teaching Fellowships:** Visiting faculty positions at East Asia University Consortium with curriculum development roles and teaching assignments.

Cendara University Affiliations & Exchange Programs > Visiting Scholars Program > 2023–2024 Recent Visiting Scholars > The Visiting Scholars Program offers short-term residencies (2–12 months) for faculty and postdoctoral researchers affiliated with partner universities.

**2023–2024 Recent Visiting Scholars:**

| Name                   | Home Institution               | Field                 | Duration     | Cendara Host Department      |
|------------------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------|--------------|-----------------------------|
| Dr. Hanae Sakamoto     | East Asia University, Japan   | Linguistics           | Mar–Aug 2023 | Department of Modern Languages |
| Prof. Rohan Nambiar    | Victoria State University     | Marine Ecology        | Jan–Jun 2024 | School of Environmental Studies|
| Dr. Inés Villalobos    | Pontifica Universidad del Sur | Urban Sociology       | Aug–Dec 2023 | Department of Sociology      |

Cendara University Affiliations & Exchange Programs > How to Apply > Steps to Application Process > **For Cendara University Students:**

- Attend a mandatory Exchange Program Information Session (monthly, OIA Conference Room).
- Consult with academic advisors for course and credit transfer planning.
- Submit complete application and supporting materials (transcript, personal statement, recommendation letter) by **March 1 (Fall)** or **October 1 (Spring)**.

**For Inbound Students:**

- Must be nominated by partner institution coordinator.
- Submit online application via Cendara University OIA Portal.
- Provide proof of English proficiency (TOEFL iBT ≥ 80 or IELTS ≥ 6.0 unless enrolled in English-medium program).

**For Faculty/Researchers:**

- Contact departmental international liaison for available placements.
- Prepare research proposal or teaching plan.
- Attach CV and evidence of institutional support from home university.

Cendara University Affiliations & Exchange Programs > Contact & Additional Information > **Cendara University Office of International Affairs**

- Email: international.affairs@cendara.edu
- Phone: +1 (839) 452-0108
- Location: Hathaway Building, Room 210, Cendara University Main Campus
- Exchange Program Coordinator: Ms. Leila Campos
- Website: https://www.cendara.edu/international

For a complete list of partner institutions and detailed program guides, visit the Office of International Affairs or consult the Exchange Handbook (2024 edition).

title: Cendara University
chunks:
Cendara University > Department of Computer Science > Course Catalog 2024–2025 > # Cendara University

## Department of Computer Science

### Course Catalog 2024–2025

---

Cendara University > Undergraduate Program — B.Sc. in Computer Science > Tracks Offered > ### Tracks Offered

- **Software Engineering**
- **Artificial Intelligence**
- **Cybersecurity**

---

Cendara University > Undergraduate Program — B.Sc. in Computer Science > Course Listings > ### Course Listings

#### CS101: Introduction to Computer Science

- **Description:**  
  An overview of the foundational concepts of computer science. Topics include algorithms, programming fundamentals, computer hardware, operating systems, and current trends in the field. Designed for students with little or no prior programming experience.

- **Prerequisites:** None  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

#### CS115: Programming Fundamentals with Python

- **Description:**  
  Introduction to structured problem-solving and algorithmic thinking using Python. Covers variable types, control structures, functions, simple data structures, and debugging practices.

- **Prerequisites:** None  
- **Credit Hours:** 4

---

#### CS130: Data Structures and Algorithms

- **Description:**  
  Concepts and implementation of fundamental data structures (lists, stacks, queues, trees, graphs) and basic algorithms (sorting, searching, recursion). Emphasis on algorithmic analysis and computational complexity.

- **Prerequisites:** CS115  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

#### CS205: Discrete Mathematics for Computer Science

- **Description:**  
  Mathematical foundations including logic, set theory, combinatorics, graph theory, and proofs relevant to computer science applications.

- **Prerequisites:** CS101 or instructor consent  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

#### CS210: Object-Oriented Programming

- **Description:**  
  Principles of object-oriented programming using Java. Topics include classes, objects, inheritance, polymorphism, encapsulation, interfaces, and software design patterns.

- **Prerequisites:** CS115  
- **Credit Hours:** 4

---

#### CS235: Computer Organization and Architecture

- **Description:**  
  Study of computer hardware and system organization. Covers digital logic, assembly language, processor design, memory hierarchy, and input/output systems.

- **Prerequisites:** CS130  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

#### CS250: Introduction to Software Engineering

- **Description:**  
  Software design and development methodologies. Topics include requirement analysis, version control, Agile principles, system modeling, testing, and documentation.

- **Prerequisites:** CS210  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

#### CS271: Principles of Cybersecurity

- **Description:**  
  An introductory course to cybersecurity concepts. Examines secure coding, cryptography basics, network security, and ethical issues in cybersecurity.

- **Prerequisites:** CS130  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

#### CS290: Database Systems

- **Description:**  
  Introduction to relational database design, SQL, normalization, transactions, and database application development. Includes hands-on lab projects.

- **Prerequisites:** CS130  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

#### CS310: Theory of Computation

- **Description:**  
  Study of automata, formal languages, Turing machines, decidability, and computational complexity.

- **Prerequisites:** CS205  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

#### CS330: Operating Systems

- **Description:**  
  Concepts and architectures of operating systems. Explores process management, CPU scheduling, memory management, file systems, and concurrency.

- **Prerequisites:** CS235  
- **Credit Hours:** 4

---

#### CS355: Artificial Intelligence Foundations

- **Description:**  
  Introduction to AI, including search algorithms, knowledge representation, reasoning, machine learning basics, and ethical issues in AI.

- **Prerequisites:** CS130  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

#### CS370: Mobile App Development

- **Description:**  
  Design and implementation of mobile applications for iOS and Android platforms. Focus on user interfaces, mobile frameworks, and cross-platform tools.

- **Prerequisites:** CS210  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

#### CS395: Special Topics in Computer Science

- **Description:**  
  Offers in-depth study of new and emerging areas in computer science. Topics vary each semester and may include Internet of Things, Blockchain, or Advanced Web Development.

- **Prerequisites:** Junior standing and instructor approval  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

#### CS401: Software Project (Capstone)

- **Description:**  
  Team-based software project integrating knowledge learned throughout the curriculum. Involves project proposal, development, testing, deployment, and presentation.

- **Prerequisites:** Senior standing, CS250  
- **Credit Hours:** 4

---

Cendara University > Undergraduate Program — B.Sc. in Computer Science > Electives by Track > ### Electives by Track

#### Software Engineering

- **CS425: Advanced Software Engineering**
- **CS432: DevOps and Continuous Integration**

#### Artificial Intelligence

- **CS441: Machine Learning**
- **CS445: Natural Language Processing**

#### Cybersecurity

- **CS460: Ethical Hacking and Penetration Testing**
- **CS466: Network Security and Forensics**

---

#### CS425: Advanced Software Engineering

- **Description:**  
  Explores advanced concepts in software engineering, including software architecture, project management, refactoring, and automated testing practices.

- **Prerequisites:** CS250  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

#### CS441: Machine Learning

- **Description:**  
  Principles and algorithms in machine learning. Covers supervised and unsupervised learning, neural networks, feature selection, model evaluation, and practical applications.

- **Prerequisites:** CS355, CS205  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

#### CS460: Ethical Hacking and Penetration Testing

- **Description:**  
  Techniques and tools used in ethical hacking, penetration testing, vulnerability assessment, and incident reporting within legal and ethical frameworks.

- **Prerequisites:** CS271  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

Cendara University > Graduate Program — M.Sc./Ph.D. in Computer Science > Core Graduate Courses > ### Core Graduate Courses

#### CS501: Advanced Algorithms

- **Description:**  
  In-depth study of algorithm design and analysis, including greedy algorithms, dynamic programming, network flows, NP-completeness, and approximation algorithms.

- **Prerequisites:** Undergraduate algorithms or equivalent  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

#### CS505: Research Methods in Computer Science

- **Description:**  
  Methodologies and practices for conducting research in computer science, including literature review, research proposal, data collection and analysis, and academic writing.

- **Prerequisites:** Graduate standing  
- **Credit Hours:** 2

---

#### CS510: Machine Learning

- **Description:**  
  Advanced topics in machine learning: supervised/unsupervised learning, deep learning, support vector machines, and current applications. Includes practical labs.

- **Prerequisites:** Undergraduate probability/statistics and algorithms or consent  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

#### CS515: Advanced Database Systems

- **Description:**  
  Concepts in database theory, distributed databases, NoSQL, data warehousing, and big data management techniques.

- **Prerequisites:** Undergraduate databases  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

#### CS538: Artificial Intelligence Seminar

- **Description:**  
  Weekly seminar series featuring research topics in AI, including robotics, natural language processing, computer vision, and ethics in intelligent systems.

- **Prerequisites:** Enrolled in M.Sc./Ph.D. or instructor approval  
- **Credit Hours:** 1

---

#### CS542: Cybersecurity Principles

- **Description:**  
  Comprehensive survey of cybersecurity threats, defense mechanisms, cryptography, secure protocols, and regulatory frameworks.

- **Prerequisites:** Undergraduate cybersecurity or equivalent  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

#### CS590: Thesis Research

- **Description:**  
  Independent research under faculty supervision culminating in a thesis or dissertation. Students define problems, conduct investigations, and present findings.

- **Prerequisites:** Completion of required graduate coursework and advisor approval  
- **Credit Hours:** 6

---

Cendara University > Graduate Program — M.Sc./Ph.D. in Computer Science > Graduate Electives > ### Graduate Electives

#### CS560: Distributed Systems

- **Description:**  
  Study of distributed computing architectures, synchronization, fault tolerance, distributed storage, and cloud computing.

- **Prerequisites:** Graduate standing  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

#### CS570: Advanced Topics in Computer Vision

- **Description:**  
  Techniques in image processing, object detection, pattern recognition, and hardware acceleration for computer vision tasks.

- **Prerequisites:** CS510 or equivalent  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

#### CS580: Special Topics in Computer Science

- **Description:**  
  Rotating advanced topics across emerging areas such as quantum computing, advanced machine learning, or ethical AI.

- **Prerequisites:** As announced per topic  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

Cendara University > Contact > # Contact

For more information about courses or degree requirements, please contact:

**Department of Computer Science**  
Cendara University  
Email: cs-advising@cendara.edu  
Phone: +1 (845) 555-7812

Our commitment to fostering innovation, leadership, and critical inquiry is reflected in the diversity and rigor of our degree offerings. Below is a summary of all degrees, schools, departments, and specialized programs currently available at Cendara University.

- **Department of Nutrition and Dietetics**

Cendara University Academic Programs Summary > Specialized Programs > - **Honors College**: Interdisciplinary honors curriculum for high-achieving undergraduates across all schools.
- **Sustainable Technology Initiative**: Focused track within Engineering on renewable energy and sustainable infrastructure.
- **International Business Concentration**: Specialized track within B.B.A. and M.B.A. integrating global business studies.

- **Global Education Exchange**: Semester-abroad and dual-degree programs with partner institutions in Europe and Asia.
- **Teacher Residency Program**: A year-long mentored teaching placement for M.Ed. students in area schools.
- **Health Informatics Certification**: Post-baccalaureate certificate offered through Health Sciences.
- **Environmental Policy Minor**: Interdisciplinary minor drawing on Environmental Engineering, Political Science, and Economics.

Cendara University Program Catalog > Contact and Further Information > For full program details, course descriptions, admissions prerequisites, and application deadlines, please refer to the [Cendara University Academic Catalog](https://catalog.cendara.edu) or contact the Office of Admissions at admissions@cendara.edu.

title: Cendara University
chunks:
Cendara University > Department of English and Comparative Literature > 2024–2025 Course Catalog > # Cendara University  
## Department of English and Comparative Literature  
### 2024–2025 Course Catalog

Cendara University > Department of English and Comparative Literature > Undergraduate Courses > ## Undergraduate Courses

### ENGL 101: Introduction to Literature

**Credits:** 3  
**Description:**  
Foundational exploration of major genres—poetry, fiction, and drama—from diverse cultures and historical periods. Emphasis on close reading, interpretive strategies, and critical discussion.

**Prerequisites:** None

---

### ENGL 102: Fundamentals of Academic Writing

**Credits:** 3  
**Description:**  
Practice in formal writing for a variety of academic disciplines. Topics include thesis development, argumentation, research methods, and citation styles.

**Prerequisites:** None

---

### ENGL 203: British Literature I

**Credits:** 3  
**Description:**  
A survey of British literature from the Anglo-Saxon period through the 18th century, including key texts by Chaucer, Shakespeare, and Milton. Attention to literary traditions, historical contexts, and cultural influence.

**Prerequisites:** ENGL 101

---

### ENGL 204: British Literature II

**Credits:** 3  
**Description:**  
Continuation of ENGL 203, focusing on Romanticism, Victorian literature, and Modernism. Authors include Wordsworth, Tennyson, Woolf, and Joyce.

**Prerequisites:** ENGL 101

---

### ENGL 211: American Literature to 1865

**Credits:** 3  
**Description:**  
Examination of major works and authors from colonization through the Civil War, including Native American, African American, and immigrant voices.

**Prerequisites:** ENGL 101

---

### ENGL 212: American Literature Since 1865

**Credits:** 3  
**Description:**  
A study of representative American literary works from the late 19th century to the present. Emphasizes realism, modernism, postmodernism, and contemporary trends.

**Prerequisites:** ENGL 101

---

### ENGL 220: World Literature in Translation

**Credits:** 3  
**Description:**  
Works from outside the British and American traditions, read in English translation. Includes poetry, drama, and prose from Asia, Africa, Latin America, and the Middle East.

**Prerequisites:** ENGL 101

---

### ENGL 231: Introduction to Linguistics

**Credits:** 3  
**Description:**  
Introduction to the scientific study of language, including phonetics, syntax, morphology, semantics, and language acquisition.

**Prerequisites:** None

---

### ENGL 251: Creative Writing

**Credits:** 3  
**Description:**  
Workshop-based introduction to writing poetry, short fiction, and creative nonfiction. Supports development of personal voice and style.

**Prerequisites:** ENGL 102 or instructor permission

---

### ENGL 260: Literature and Film

**Credits:** 3  
**Description:**  
Explores the relationship between written texts and film adaptations. Comparative analysis of narrative strategies, genre conventions, and cultural contexts.

**Prerequisites:** ENGL 101

---

### ENGL 299: Special Topics in English

**Credits:** 1–3  
**Description:**  
Rotating topics of current interest in literature, writing, or linguistics. Recent offerings have included "The Gothic Imagination," "Digital Storytelling," and "Eco-Criticism."

**Prerequisites:** At least one prior ENGL course

---

Cendara University > Department of English and Comparative Literature > Upper-Level Undergraduate and Graduate Courses > ## Upper-Level Undergraduate and Graduate Courses

### ENGL 301: Shakespeare

**Credits:** 3  
**Description:**  
Intensive analysis of selected plays and poetry by William Shakespeare. Focus on themes, language, dramatic structure, and socio-historical context.

**Prerequisites:** ENGL 203

---

### ENGL 315: The African Diaspora in Literature

**Credits:** 3  
**Description:**  
Study of literary works by writers of the African diaspora, addressing themes of identity, migration, and community. Authors include Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie, Derek Walcott, and Ta-Nehisi Coates.

**Prerequisites:** ENGL 101 or 211

---

### ENGL 332: Advanced Grammar and Style

**Credits:** 3  
**Description:**  
Detailed examination of English grammar and stylistic conventions, emphasizing practical application in editing and writing.

**Prerequisites:** ENGL 231

---

### ENGL 340: Literary Theory and Criticism

**Credits:** 3  
**Description:**  
Survey of major theoretical frameworks, including structuralism, postcolonialism, feminism, and psychoanalytic criticism. Application to selected texts.

**Prerequisites:** Two 200-level ENGL courses

---

### ENGL 350: Writing for Digital Media

**Credits:** 3  
**Description:**  
Study and practice of writing for online platforms, including blogs, podcasts, and social media. Attention to audience, ethics, and multimodal storytelling.

**Prerequisites:** ENGL 102

---

### ENGL 370: Studies in Modern Poetry

**Credits:** 3  
**Description:**  
Exploration of major poets and modern poetic movements from the 20th century to the present. Includes work from Eliot, Plath, Hughes, Bishop, and Heaney.

**Prerequisites:** ENGL 203 or 204

---

### ENGL 451: Senior Seminar in English

**Credits:** 3  
**Description:**  
Capstone seminar for senior English majors. Students complete independent research projects and present their findings in a public symposium.

**Prerequisites:** Senior standing; completion of at least two 300-level ENGL courses

---

### ENGL 498: Honors Thesis

**Credits:** 6 (over two semesters)  
**Description:**  
Individualized research and thesis writing under faculty supervision on a topic approved by the department.

**Prerequisites:** Invitation to Honors Program; ENGL 340

---

Cendara University > Department of English and Comparative Literature > Graduate Courses > ## Graduate Courses

### ENGL 520: Research Methods in Literary Studies

**Credits:** 3  
**Description:**  
Fundamentals of advanced research, bibliographical strategies, and theory application in literary study. Preparation for thesis work.

**Prerequisites:** Admission to M.A. or Ph.D. program

---

### ENGL 531: Seminar in Comparative Literature

**Credits:** 3  
**Description:**  
Comparative analysis of texts from different literary traditions, periods, or languages. Emphasizes interdisciplinary approaches.

**Prerequisites:** Graduate standing

---

### ENGL 550: Critical Theory

**Credits:** 3  
**Description:**  
Close study of key texts in 20th and 21st-century critical theory. Topics include deconstruction, queer theory, new historicism, and more.

**Prerequisites:** ENGL 340 or equivalent

---

### ENGL 571: Pedagogy in English Studies

**Credits:** 3  
**Description:**  
Introduction to theories and practices of teaching composition and literature at the college level. Includes supervised teaching practicum.

**Prerequisites:** Graduate standing

---

### ENGL 598: Directed Reading

**Credits:** 1–3  
**Description:**  
Supervised reading program on a specialized topic not covered in regular courses, developed in consultation with a faculty mentor.

**Prerequisites:** Departmental approval

---

### ENGL 599: Thesis Research

**Credits:** 6 (over two semesters)  
**Description:**  
M.A. and Ph.D. thesis research and writing under supervision of a departmental advisor. Oral defense required.

**Prerequisites:** Completion of coursework and proposal approval

---

Cendara University > Department of English and Comparative Literature > Additional Information > **Note:**  
Some courses may be offered only in alternate years or terms. For scheduling and instructor assignments, consult the departmental website or contact the Office of the Registrar.

title: Cendara University Financial Aid Guide
chunks:
Cendara University Financial Aid Guide Academic Year 2024–2025, Office of Financial Assistance, 2nd Floor, Founders Hall > Introduction > # Cendara University Financial Aid Guide  
*Academic Year 2024–2025*

The Office of Financial Assistance is dedicated to making a Cendara University education accessible and affordable. Cendara offers a range of scholarships, grants, loans, and work-study opportunities to help offset educational expenses outlined in the annual fee structure. This guide details available aid programs and provides step-by-step application instructions.

To contact us:  
**Office of Financial Assistance**  
2nd Floor, Founders Hall  
Email: financial.aid@cendara.edu | Phone: (317) 555-2473

---

Cendara University Financial Aid Guide Academic Year 2024–2025, Office of Financial Assistance, 2nd Floor, Founders Hall > Types of Financial Aid > ## 1. Types of Financial Aid

Cendara University offers the following forms of assistance:

- **Scholarships:** Merit-based, talent-based, and need-based awards that do not require repayment.
- **Grants:** Need-based aid, typically from university, state, or federal sources; no repayment required.
- **Loans:** Borrowed funds that must be repaid with interest; both federal and institutional loans are available.
- **Work-Study:** Part-time campus employment to earn money during the academic year.

Each student may be eligible for a combination of these aid types.

---

Cendara University Financial Aid Guide Academic Year 2024–2025, Office of Financial Assistance, 2nd Floor, Founders Hall > Scholarships > Merit Scholarships > ### 2.1 Merit Scholarships

| Scholarship Name          | Eligibility                                   | Value per Year    | Renewable   | Special Criteria                            |
|--------------------------|-----------------------------------------------|-------------------|-------------|---------------------------------------------|
| Presidential Scholarship | Incoming first-year undergraduates; top 5% of applicants (GPA ≥ 3.95, SAT ≥ 1450/ACT ≥ 33, or IB 40+) | $18,000           | 4 years     | Leadership & community contribution         |
| Cardinal Scholar Award   | All new undergraduates with strong academics (GPA ≥ 3.6)       | $7,000 – $12,000  | 4 years     | Automatic consideration                     |
| Graduate Dean’s Award   | New graduate students, outstanding prior GPA (≥ 3.85)             | $5,000 – $9,000   | Up to 2 years| Department recommendation required          |
| Provost Transfer Award   | Transfer students (≥ 30 credits, GPA ≥ 3.75)                    | $6,000            | 2 years     |                                             |

---

Cendara University Financial Aid Guide Academic Year 2024–2025, Office of Financial Assistance, 2nd Floor, Founders Hall > Scholarships > Competitive & Special Achievement Scholarships > ### 2.2 Competitive & Special Achievement Scholarships

| Scholarship Name             | Who Can Apply          | Value            | Criteria                                                      |
|-----------------------------|------------------------|------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------|
| Cendara Arts Fellowship      | First-year or transfer | $4,000           | Portfolio review; visual/performing arts majors                |
| Cendara STEM Scholars        | First-year             | $8,000           | Demonstrated excellence in STEM fields; interview required     |
| Global Diversity Scholarship | Int’l & U.S. students  | $5,000–$10,000   | Promoting campus diversity; essay & recommendation required     |
| First-Generation Promise     | First in family to attend college | $3,500         | FAFSA/CSS Profile required; preference for Pell-eligible      |
| Valentina Mateo Leadership Award | All undergraduates | $2,000           | Outstanding leadership/service during prior studies            |

- **Application deadlines**: Most scholarships require fall term applications by February 15; some have additional interview or portfolio dates in March.

---

Cendara University Financial Aid Guide Academic Year 2024–2025, Office of Financial Assistance, 2nd Floor, Founders Hall > Scholarships > Departmental & Donor Scholarships > ### 2.3 Departmental & Donor Scholarships

Each department manages additional awards (ranging: $1,000–$6,000/year), often tied to academic major, talent, or declared area of interest.  
Visit [scholarships.cendara.edu/departments](https://scholarships.cendara.edu/departments) for details and application instructions.

---

Cendara University Financial Aid Guide Academic Year 2024–2025, Office of Financial Assistance, 2nd Floor, Founders Hall > Grants > ## 3. Grants

Cendara administers several need-based grant programs drawn from institutional, federal, and state sources.

| Grant Name                  | Eligibility                | Value per Year        | Application           |
|-----------------------------|----------------------------|----------------------|-----------------------|
| Cendara Access Grant        | Undergrad (full-time); based on demonstrated financial need | $2,000–$8,000         | FAFSA or CSS Profile  |
| Federal Pell Grant          | U.S. citizens/permanent residents; demonstrated high need | Up to $7,395           | FAFSA                 |
| State Opportunity Grant     | Indiana residents (full-time undergrad/grad); need-based | $1,200–$4,500         | FAFSA                 |
| Graduate Tuition Grant      | Graduate students (limited selection)                     | $2,500–$5,000         | FAFSA or separate app |

- **Award amounts** depend on Expected Family Contribution (EFC), cost of attendance, and funding levels.
- All grants are subject to annual review and funding availability.

---

Cendara University Financial Aid Guide Academic Year 2024–2025, Office of Financial Assistance, 2nd Floor, Founders Hall > Loans > Federal Student Loans (U.S. citizens/permanent residents) > ### 4.1 Federal Student Loans (U.S. citizens/permanent residents)

| Loan                          | Annual Borrowing Limit            | Typical Interest Rate | Notes                         |
|-------------------------------|-----------------------------------|----------------------|-------------------------------|
| Direct Subsidized Loan        | $3,500–$5,500 (undergrad)         | 5.50%                | Need-based, interest subsidized|
| Direct Unsubsidized Loan      | $2,000–$20,500 (undergrad/grad)   | 5.50%–7.05%          | Interest accrues immediately  |
| Grad PLUS Loan                | Cost of attendance minus aid      | 8.05%                | Credit check required         |
| Parent PLUS Loan              | Parent borrower for undergrads    | 8.05%                | Credit check required         |

---

Cendara University Financial Aid Guide Academic Year 2024–2025, Office of Financial Assistance, 2nd Floor, Founders Hall > Loans > Institutional Loan Programs (Domestic & International) > ### 4.2 Institutional Loan Programs (Domestic & International)

- **Cendara Opportunity Loan**: Up to $7,500/year (Fixed 6.25% interest, deferred repayment until 6 months post-graduation; cosigner required for international students)
- **Short-term Emergency Loan**: Up to $1,200/semester (No interest, payable within 6 months)

**Note:** Loan counseling is required for all new borrowers.

---

Cendara University Financial Aid Guide Academic Year 2024–2025, Office of Financial Assistance, 2nd Floor, Founders Hall > Work-Study Employment > ## 5. Work-Study Employment

Cendara’s Federal and Institutional Work-Study programs provide part-time, on-campus jobs to assist students in meeting expenses.

- Typical positions: Library assistant, lab tech, campus events, dining hall, research aide
- Hourly pay: $12 – $15 (undergraduate), $14 – $18 (graduate)
- Maximum hours: 15/week during terms

Eligibility depends on need and timely application; indicate work-study interest on the FAFSA or Cendara Application for Aid.

---

Cendara University Financial Aid Guide Academic Year 2024–2025, Office of Financial Assistance, 2nd Floor, Founders Hall > Application Procedures > Steps to Apply for Financial Aid > ## 6. Application Procedures

To receive financial aid, applicants must complete the appropriate forms and follow these steps:

### Step 1: Gather Required Documents

- Student and parent tax returns (prior-prior year, e.g., 2022 for 2024–25)
- W-2s and other income statements
- Bank statements and records of investments
- Social Security numbers or governmental IDs (if applicable)
- Academic transcripts for some merit aid

### Step 2: Complete Applications

| Aid Type             | Required Application(s) | Link / Submission Method                        |
|----------------------|------------------------|------------------------------------------------|
| Federal Aid (U.S.)   | FAFSA                  | [https://studentaid.gov](https://studentaid.gov) (School Code: 036469) |
| Need-Based Aid (Intl)| CSS Profile            | [https://cssprofile.collegeboard.org](https://cssprofile.collegeboard.org) |
| University Scholarships | Cendara Scholarship Portal | [scholarships.cendara.edu/apply](https://scholarships.cendara.edu/apply) |
| Indiana State Grants | FAFSA (by April 15)    | Same as above                                  |

title: Cendara University
chunks:
Cendara University > Department of Nursing > B.N.S. in Nursing — Course Catalog Overview > The Bachelor of Nursing Science (B.N.S.) program at Cendara University is designed to prepare students for registered nurse licensure and to excel in modern clinical environments. The curriculum blends rigorous academic coursework with hands-on experience in partner hospitals. 

Below is a comprehensive catalog of undergraduate courses offered by the Department of Nursing. Each listing includes the course title, code, detailed description, prerequisites, and credit hours.

---

Cendara University > Department of Nursing > Year 1 Courses > ### NURS 101: Foundations of Professional Nursing  
- **Description:**  
  Introduces the core principles, history, and ethical standards of the nursing profession. Emphasizes patient-centered care, communication skills, and professional conduct.
- **Prerequisites:** None  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

### NURS 111: Human Anatomy & Physiology I  
- **Description:**  
  Focuses on the structural and functional organization of the human body with emphasis on the musculoskeletal, nervous, and cardiovascular systems.
- **Prerequisites:** None  
- **Credit Hours:** 4

---

### NURS 112: Human Anatomy & Physiology II  
- **Description:**  
  Continues NURS 111 with a focus on the respiratory, digestive, urinary, and reproductive systems. Includes laboratory sessions and case studies.
- **Prerequisites:** NURS 111  
- **Credit Hours:** 4

---

### NURS 120: Health Assessment  
- **Description:**  
  Offers theoretical and practical foundations in physical assessment techniques, including the use of diagnostic equipment and patient interviewing.
- **Prerequisites:** NURS 111 (may be taken concurrently)  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

### NURS 130: Introduction to Clinical Practice  
- **Description:**  
  Provides supervised clinical experiences in a laboratory and hospital setting. Focus on basic nursing skills such as hygiene, infection control, and patient mobility.
- **Prerequisites:** NURS 101, NURS 111  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

Cendara University > Department of Nursing > Year 2 Courses > ### NURS 210: Microbiology for Nurses  
- **Description:**  
  Explores major concepts of microbiology relevant to nursing, including pathogens, infection control, and the immune response.
- **Prerequisites:** NURS 112  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

### NURS 212: Pharmacology I  
- **Description:**  
  Covers fundamental pharmacological principles, drug classifications, and medication administration safety for entry-level nurses.
- **Prerequisites:** NURS 112  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

### NURS 220: Medical-Surgical Nursing I  
- **Description:**  
  Introduces the care of adults experiencing common medical and surgical health problems. Integrates knowledge across body systems with emphasis on assessment and intervention.
- **Prerequisites:** NURS 120, NURS 130  
- **Credit Hours:** 4

---

### NURS 221: Medical-Surgical Nursing II  
- **Description:**  
  Builds on NURS 220 by addressing complex health conditions and advanced intervention techniques. Includes simulation and clinical rotations.
- **Prerequisites:** NURS 220  
- **Credit Hours:** 4

---

### NURS 231: Nursing Research & Evidence-Based Practice  
- **Description:**  
  Examines the principles and processes of nursing research. Develops skills in appraising evidence and applying findings to clinical decisions.
- **Prerequisites:** NURS 120, NURS 130  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

Cendara University > Department of Nursing > Year 3 Courses > ### NURS 310: Pediatric Nursing  
- **Description:**  
  Covers nursing care for children and adolescents, including developmental stages, health promotion, and family-centered care.
- **Prerequisites:** NURS 220  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

### NURS 312: Maternity & Women’s Health Nursing  
- **Description:**  
  Examines nursing roles in prenatal, perinatal, and postpartum care. Addresses family planning, newborn assessment, and reproductive health issues.
- **Prerequisites:** NURS 221  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

### NURS 319: Pathophysiology  
- **Description:**  
  Detailed study of altered physiological processes in major body systems as related to disease processes encountered in nursing practice.
- **Prerequisites:** NURS 112  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

### NURS 330: Mental Health Nursing  
- **Description:**  
  Focuses on therapeutic communication, psychiatric disorders, and evidence-based interventions in mental health settings.
- **Prerequisites:** NURS 221  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

### NURS 340: Community Health Nursing  
- **Description:**  
  Prepares students to employ health promotion and disease prevention strategies, conduct assessments, and plan interventions in community settings.
- **Prerequisites:** NURS 231  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

Cendara University > Department of Nursing > Year 4 Courses > ### NURS 410: Leadership & Management in Nursing  
- **Description:**  
  Explores concepts of leadership, management theory, and interprofessional teamwork in healthcare settings. Includes quality improvement and resource management.
- **Prerequisites:** NURS 221, Senior Standing  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

### NURS 420: Advanced Clinical Practicum  
- **Description:**  
  Provides intensive clinical immersion across multiple specialties, including critical care, emergency, and surgical nursing. Students work closely with assigned preceptors in partner hospitals.
- **Prerequisites:** NURS 221, completion of all previous clinical courses  
- **Credit Hours:** 6

---

### NURS 431: Nursing Ethics & Health Policy  
- **Description:**  
  Studies ethical dilemmas in nursing practice, legal responsibilities, and the impact of health policy on patient care and professional standards.
- **Prerequisites:** NURS 231  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

### NURS 440: Capstone Seminar  
- **Description:**  
  Integrates learning from all previous coursework and clinical experiences. Preparation for the national licensure exam (NCLEX-RN) and transition to professional practice.
- **Prerequisites:** NURS 420 (may be taken concurrently)  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

Cendara University > Department of Nursing > Elective Courses > ### NURS 350: Gerontological Nursing  
- **Description:**  
  Explores the unique healthcare needs and challenges in nursing older adults. Addresses chronic disease management, cognitive decline, and elder care advocacy.
- **Prerequisites:** NURS 221  
- **Credit Hours:** 3

---

### NURS 355: Nursing Informatics  
- **Description:**  
  Introduces digital health records, data management, and the role of informatics in evidence-based nursing practice.
- **Prerequisites:** NURS 231  
- **Credit Hours:** 2

---

### NURS 360: Disaster & Emergency Nursing  
- **Description:**  
  Prepares students to manage nursing care in disaster, crisis, and mass casualty situations. Focuses on triage, crisis intervention, and readiness planning.
- **Prerequisites:** NURS 221  
- **Credit Hours:** 2

---

Cendara University > Department of Nursing > Further Information > For further information on course sequencing, graduation requirements, and departmental policies, please refer to the B.N.S. Student Handbook or contact the Department of Nursing at nursing@cendara.edu.
